importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, marking the conclusion of the ALCS Game 7 and the Blue Jays' advancement to the World Series.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time of the update and publication of the article, indicating the immediacy and real-time nature of the sports event coverage.

keyTakeAways: George Springer hit a three-run home run in the seventh inning of Game 7 to give the Toronto Blue Jays a crucial lead, ending their playoff drought and sending them to the World Series.
The Blue Jays won the American League Championship Series 4-3 against the Seattle Mariners, securing their first World Series berth since 1993.
The victory was made possible by a controversial play involving Jorge Polanco and Josh Naylor, where a ricocheting ball off Naylor’s helmet led to a controversial call that impacted the game’s flow.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP with a .385 batting average and three home runs in the series.
The Blue Jays will face the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, hosted at Rogers Centre in Toronto.
The Seattle Mariners remain the only MLB franchise never to have appeared in a World Series, highlighting a significant historical gap in their playoff success.
George Springer, injured in Game 5, returned to play in Games 6 and 7 despite physical pain, demonstrating his dedication to the team and fans.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: George Springer’s three-run home run in the seventh inning of Game 7 was the pivotal play that secured the Toronto Blue Jays’ victory and propelled them to the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Toronto, Canada
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays won the American League Championship Series and advanced to the World Series, marking their first appearance since 1993.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Seattle, Washington
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Seattle Mariners lost Game 7 of the ALCS to the Blue Jays, ending their playoff run and remaining the only MLB franchise never to have reached the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team in Los Angeles, California

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP for his outstanding performance, including a .385 batting average and three home runs in the series.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodriguez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rodriguez hit a three-run home run in the third inning and led off the fifth with a solo shot, contributing significantly to the Mariners' early lead.

namedEntities.name: Cal Raleigh
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Raleigh hit a fifth long ball in the playoffs, including four against the Blue Jays, and was a key offensive contributor for the Mariners.

namedEntities.name: Eduardo Bazardo
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bazardo was the pitcher facing George Springer in the seventh inning, under whom Springer hit the decisive three-run home run.

namedEntities.name: Shane Bieber
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bieber was the pitcher who gave up a solo home run to Julio Rodriguez in the third inning of Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Chris Bassitt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Bassitt pitched a scoreless eighth inning in Game 7 to help preserve the Blue Jays’ lead.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Jeff Hoffman closed out the game in the ninth inning, striking out all three Mariners batters and securing the Blue Jays’ win.

namedEntities.name: Jorge Polanco
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Polanco hit a groundball that led to a controversial call involving Josh Naylor, where the ball ricocheted off Naylor’s helmet.

namedEntities.name: Josh Naylor
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Naylor drove in Julio Rodriguez with a single in the first inning and was involved in a controversial play where his helmet caused a ricochet, leading to a disputed out.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Varsho tied the game 1-1 in the bottom of the first inning with a soft groundball single.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 4-3 in Game 7 of the American League Championship Series, advancing to their first World Series since 1993. The pivotal moment came when George Springer hit a three-run home run in the seventh inning, turning a dire situation into a winning momentum. The game saw controversy over a play involving Josh Naylor and Jorge Polanco, where a ricochet off Naylor’s helmet led to a disputed out. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP with a .385 average and three home runs. The Blue Jays will face the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, while the Mariners remain the only MLB team never to have reached a World Series.
title: George Springer’s epic home run helps send the Toronto Blue Jays to the World Series with ALCS Game 7 win over Seattle
